page.title: 11S. LEONARD'S HOMES
page.content: S. Leonard's Children's Homes stand quiet, silent and empty. Every one of the original buildings is there. The grass is overgrown and weeds are everywhere. The cottages have been boarded up. There is a lot of ivy over some doors. The chapel is still there but the statue of Charity and two children has been removed to a museum. The Homes were built in the last century for the poor children and orphans of East London. It was a self-contained village with eleven cottages, a hospital, school, chapel, bakery, workshop, needleroom, stores, offices and accomodation for staff. They grew their own vegetables and kept their own hens and livestock. The children have gone to private foster homes. Soon the developers will move in and build new houses.
